text.p: Click on a column header to sort the table.

ROW.title: Absolute Peak Audio File Path
ROW.tagdesc: The absolute path to the file's peak audio file. If empty, no peak file exists.

ROW.title: Album
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the album.

ROW.title: Alternative Tape Name
ROW.tagdesc: An alternative tape name, set via the project window or timecode dialog in Premiere. If an alternative name has been set and has not been reverted, that name is displayed.

ROW.title: Alternative Time code
ROW.tagdesc: A timecode set by the user. When specified, it is used instead of the startTimecode.

ROW.title: Artist
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the artist or artists.

ROW.title: Audio Modified Date
ROW.tagdesc: (deprecated) The date and time when the audio was last modified.

ROW.title: Audio Channel Type
ROW.tagdesc: The audio channel type. One of: Mono, Stereo, 5.1, 7.1, 16 Channel, Other.

ROW.title: Audio Compressor
ROW.tagdesc: The audio compression used. For example, MP3.

ROW.title: Audio Sample Rate
ROW.tagdesc: The audio sample rate. Can be any value, but commonly 32000, 44100, or 48000.

ROW.title: Audio Sample Type
ROW.tagdesc: The audio sample type. One of: 8Int, 16Int, 24Int, 32Int, 32Float, Compressed, Packed, Other.

ROW.title: Beat Splice Parameters
ROW.tagdesc: Additional parameters for Beat Splice stretch mode.

ROW.title: Camera Angle
ROW.tagdesc: The orientation of the camera to the subject in a static shot, from a fixed set of industry standard terminology. Predefined values include:Low Angle, Eye Level, High Angle, Overhead Shot, Birds Eye Shot, Dutch Angle, POV, Over the Shoulder, Reaction Shot.

ROW.title: Camera Label
ROW.tagdesc: A description of the camera used for a shoot. Can be any string, but is usually simply a number, for example "1", "2", or more explicitly "Camera 1".

ROW.title: Camera Model
ROW.tagdesc: The make and model of the camera used for a shoot.

ROW.title: Camera Move
ROW.tagdesc: The movement of the camera during the shot, from a fixed set of industry standard terminology. Predefined values include: Aerial, Boom Up, Boom Down, Crane Up, Crane Down, Dolly In, Dolly Out, Pan Left, Pan Right, Pedestal Up, Pedestal Down, Tilt Up, Tilt Down, Tracking, Truck Left, Truck Right, Zoom In, Zoom Out.

ROW.title: Client
ROW.tagdesc: The client for the job of which this shot or take is a part.

ROW.title: Comment
ROW.tagdesc: A user's comments.

ROW.title: Composer
ROW.tagdesc: The composer's name.

ROW.title: Contributed Media
ROW.tagdesc: An unordered list of all media used to create this media.

ROW.title: Copyright
ROW.tagdesc: (Deprecated in favour of dc:rights.) The copyright information.

ROW.title: Director
ROW.tagdesc: The director of the scene.

ROW.title: Director Photography
ROW.tagdesc: The director of photography for the scene.

ROW.title: Duration
ROW.tagdesc: The duration of the media file.

ROW.title: Engineer
ROW.tagdesc: The engineer's name.

ROW.title: File Data Rate
ROW.tagdesc: The file data rate in megabytes per second. For example: "36/10" = 3.6 MB/sec

ROW.title: Genre
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the genre.

ROW.title: Good
ROW.tagdesc: A checkbox for tracking whether a shot is a keeper.

ROW.title: Instrument
ROW.tagdesc: The musical instrument.

ROW.title: Intro Time
ROW.tagdesc: The duration of lead time for queuing music.

ROW.title: Key
ROW.tagdesc: The audio's musical key. One of: C, C#, D, D#, E, F, F#, G, G#, A, A#, B.

ROW.title: Log Comment
ROW.tagdesc: User's log comments.

ROW.title: Loop
ROW.tagdesc: When true, the clip can be looped seamlessly.

ROW.title: Number Of Beats
ROW.tagdesc: The number of beats.

ROW.title: Markers
ROW.tagdesc: An ordered list of markers

ROW.title: Metadata Modified Date
ROW.tagdesc: (deprecated) The date and time when the metadata was last modified.

ROW.title: Out Cue
ROW.tagdesc: The time at which to fade out.

ROW.title: Project Name
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the project of which this file is a part.

ROW.title: Project Reference
ROW.tagdesc: A reference to the project that created this file.

ROW.title: Pull Down
ROW.tagdesc: The sampling phase of film to be converted to video (pull-down). One of: WSSWW, SSWWW, SWWWS, WWWSS, WWSSW, WSSWW_24p, SSWWW_24p, SWWWS_24p, WWWSS_24p, WWSSW_24p.

ROW.title: Relative Peak Audio File Path
ROW.tagdesc: The relative path to the file's peak audio file. If empty, no peak file exists.

ROW.title: Relative Timestamp
ROW.tagdesc: The start time of the media inside the audio project.

ROW.title: Release Date
ROW.tagdesc: The date the title was released.

ROW.title: Resample Parameters
ROW.tagdesc: Additional parameters for Resample stretch mode.

ROW.title: Scale Type
ROW.tagdesc: The musical scale used in the music. One of: Major, Minor, Both, Neither.

ROW.title: Scene
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the scene.

ROW.title: Shot Date
ROW.tagdesc: The date and time when the video was shot.

ROW.title: Shot Day
ROW.tagdesc: The day in a multiday shoot. For example: "Day 2", "Friday".

ROW.title: Shot Location
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the location where the video was shot. For example: "Oktoberfest, Munich Germany" For more accurate positioning, use the EXIF GPS values.

ROW.title: Shot Name
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the shot or take.

ROW.title: Shot Number
ROW.tagdesc: The position of the shot in a script or production, relative to other shots. For example: 1, 2, 1a, 1b, 1.1, 1.2.

ROW.title: Shot Size
ROW.tagdesc: The size or scale of the shot framing, from a fixed set of industry standard terminology. Predefined values include: ECU --extreme close-up, MCU -- medium close-up. CU -- close-up, MS -- medium shot, WS -- wide shot, MWS -- medium wide shot, EWS -- extreme wide shot.

ROW.title: Speaker Placement
ROW.tagdesc: A description of the speaker angles from center front in degrees. For example: "Left = -30, Right = 30, Center = 0, LFE = 45, Left Surround = -110, Right Surround = 110"

ROW.title: Start Time Code
ROW.tagdesc: The timecode of the first frame of video in the file, as obtained from the device control.

ROW.title: Stretch Mode
ROW.tagdesc: The audio stretch mode. One of: Fixed length, Time-Scale, Resample, Beat Splice, Hybrid.

ROW.title: Take Number
ROW.tagdesc: A numeric value indicating the absolute number of a take.

ROW.title: Tape Name
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the tape from which the clip was captured, as set during the capture process.

ROW.title: Tempo
ROW.tagdesc: The audio's tempo.

ROW.title: Time Scale Parameters
ROW.tagdesc: Additional parameters for Time-Scale stretch mode.

ROW.title: Time Signature
ROW.tagdesc: The time signature of the music. One of: 2/4, 3/4, 4/4, 5/4, 7/4, 6/8, 9/8, 12/8, other.

ROW.title: Track Number
ROW.tagdesc: A numeric value indicating the order of the audio file within its original recording.

ROW.title: Tracks
ROW.tagdesc: An unordered list of tracks. A track is a named set of markers, which can specify a frame rate for all markers in the set. See also xmpDM:markers.

ROW.title: Video Alpha Mode
ROW.tagdesc: The alpha mode. One of: straight, pre-multiplied.

ROW.title: Video Alpha Premultiple Color
ROW.tagdesc: A color in CMYK or RGB to be used as the pre-multiple color when alpha mode is pre-multiplied.

ROW.title: Video Alpha Unity Is Transparent
ROW.tagdesc: When true, unity is clear, when false, it is opaque.

ROW.title: Video Color Space
ROW.tagdesc: The color space. One of: sRGB (used by Photoshop), CCIR-601 (used for NTSC), CCIR-709 (used for HD).

ROW.title: Video Compressor
ROW.tagdesc: Video compression used. For example, jpeg.

ROW.title: Video Field Order
ROW.tagdesc: The field order for video. One of: Upper, Lower, Progressive.

ROW.title: Video Frame Rate
ROW.tagdesc: The video frame rate. One of: 24, NTSC, PAL.

ROW.title: Video Frame Size
ROW.tagdesc: The frame size. For example: w:720, h: 480, unit:pixels

ROW.title: Video Modified Date
ROW.tagdesc: (deprecated)The date and time when the video was last modified.

ROW.title: Video Pixel Depth
ROW.tagdesc: The size in bits of each color component of a pixel. Standard Windows 32-bit pixels have 8 bits per component. One of: 8Int, 16Int, 32Int, 32Float.

ROW.title: Video Pixel Aspect Ratio
ROW.tagdesc: The aspect ratio, expressed as ht/wd. For example: "648/720" = 0.9

ROW.title: Part Of Compilation
ROW.tagdesc: Part of compilation.

ROW.title: Lyrics
ROW.tagdesc: Lyrics text. No association with timecode.

ROW.title: Disc Number
ROW.tagdesc: If in a multi-disc set, might contain total number of discs. For example: 2/3.
